item.title: Subnautica 2 Delay May Cost Studio $250 Million Bonus - Report
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Earlier this month, the founders of Unknown Worlds--the studio behind Subnautica and its upcoming sequel, Subnautica 2--were reportedly forced out of the studio by parent company Krafton. Now, it's being alleged that Krafton's decision to delay Subnautica 2 into 2026 could cost developer Unknown Worlds' team a $250 million bonus.

According to Bloomberg, Unknown Worlds' ousted leaders--Subnautica director and designer Charlie Cleveland, Unknown Worlds co-founder Max McGuire, and CEO Ted Gill--were against delaying Subnautica 2. Cleveland recently shared his belief that Subnautica 2 is ready for early-release now, which was the original plan for the game's rollout this year.

Krafton was reportedly going to be on the hook for the $250 million bonus if Unknown Worlds reached revenue goals before the end of this year. But without Subnautica 2's early access release, those numbers are likely to fall short of those targets.

The report indicates that Unknown Worlds' former leaders planned to share the bonus with all of the studio's employees. Steve Papoutsis--the new CEO of Unknown Worlds--was reportedly asked about the bonus at a town hall meeting. Papoutsis is said to have replied that he wasn't told anything about the bonus and wasn't aware if it had been a factor in the decision to push back the game.

Krafton hasn't set a specific release date for Subnautica 2.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Best Prime Day PS5 And Nintendo Switch Game Deals At Amazon
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you're looking to to your collection of physical video games for PS5, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox Series X, Amazon Prime Day 2025 has some noteworthy deals on a ton of games across all genres. The gaming section of the sale is especially great for turn-based RPG fans who want to revisit games from previous generations thanks to the best-ever discounts on retro collections and remakes such as Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake, Suikoden I & II HD Remastered, and Final Fantasy I-VI Collection.

You'll also find deals on AAA games from 2024 and 2025, including the largest price cuts so far on Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 and Assassin's Creed Shadows.

Amazon Prime Day: Video Game Deals Hubs

  • PlayStation 5 Deals:
    • Physical games
    • Accessories
  • Nintendo Switch Deals:
    • Physical games
    • Accessories
  • Xbox Deals:
    • Physical games
    • Accessories

We've rounded up the best Prime Day game deals for Nintendo Switch, PS5, and Xbox Series X. This roundup only focuses on Amazon's deals, but we'd also recommend checking out Walmart's Deals event, Target Circle Week, and Best Buy Black Friday in July for more deals. We also have a roundup on Nintendo Switch exclusives that includes a handful of great Super Mario game deals.

Prime Day: Best Nintendo Switch & Switch 2 Game Deals

Along with the three aforementioned (and pictured) RPGs, Nintendo Switch and Switch 2 users can save on other retro compilations like Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection and Jurassic Park Classic Games Collection. You can also get great deals on a bunch of simulation games, including the very popular Hello Kitty Island Adventure.

Prime Day: Best PS5 Game Deals

PS5 users can save on all of the most recent Final Fantasy games. In addition to the Pixel Remaster Collection for $42.74 (was $75), Amazon has deals on Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth, the recently reprinted FF7 Remake Intergrade, and Final Fantasy 16.

Prime Day: Best Xbox Game Deals

Xbox has shifted away from physical games in recent years, and that trend has carried over to some third-party publishers, too. As such, there are always fewer Xbox Series X deals during these big sales events. That said, Alan Wake 2's Deluxe Edition and Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 are available for new all-time low prices. Alan Wake 2 is only $38, while Space Marine 2 is down to $34. Suikoden I & II HD Remastered is also one dollar cheaper on Xbox than PS5 and Switch.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure Is Having Some Fun In The Sun With New Updates
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It's that time of the year again, and the Sunshine Celebration has returned in Hello Kitty Island Adventure once more. In the newest update for the game, out July 10, players can kick back with their favorite Sanrio characters, don festive attire, and add tropical clothing and furniture to their collection.

In addition to the celebration, another major content update for Hello Kitty Island Adventure is available now on Apple Arcade and coming soon to Nintendo Switch and Steam.

In the City Classics update, My Melody is searching for furniture, and Kuromi has become hyper-focused on everything pirates. Players can join them on a treasure hunt to unlock a new way to explore the island and unique furniture sets designed especially for those characters. Players looking for mementos can buy new Usahana and City Town souvenirs like mugs, shirts, and even a snow globe, in the Tourist Shop. Just dive into your tourist kiosk and continue to unravel the mysteries of City Town.

These are the latest updates following the big spring update back in May's Month of Meh, featuring Sanrio's eggfolk Nisetama-san and a photo challenge. These updates are free on all platforms, with more content coming soon.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure is now available on Nintendo Switch, Steam, and Apple Arcade.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/hello-kitty-island-adventure-is-having-some-fun-in-the-sun-with-new-updates/1100-6533068/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: GameStop Is Auctioning Off The Stapler--And The Staple--That Damaged A Nintendo Switch 2 On Launch Day
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

One infamous story that emerged from the Nintendo Switch 2 launch in early June came from the Staten Island section of New York City, where a GameStop employee stapled a receipt for the console to its box--which damaged the Switch 2's screen in the process. Now, GameStop is turning this blunder into a boon for Children's Miracle Network Hospitals, as the company is auctioning off multiple items from the incident--including the staple itself--for charity.

The eBay listing for the charity auction includes a letter from GameStop CEO Ryan Cohen, confirming that all four items included in the auction are "authentic relics from the now-infamous 'Staplegate' incident." Cohen's message also says that, "while the incident itself was unfortunate, [GameStop] hope[s] its legacy serves a greater purpose." Cohen also says he will include his underwear if the price hits six figures, which sounds like a threat.

The four items included in the auction are as follows:

  • The staple used in the incident, which is described as "a retail legend born from a half-second decision"
  • The Nintendo Switch 2 console itself, with a repaired screen
  • The full retail packaging of the console, "with the staple mark clearly visible"
  • The individual staple that damaged the console, which has been "carefully extracted and preserved" in an "individual display pouch"

The auction--which is raising money for Children's Miracle Network, per the eBay listing--has surpassed $15,000 in bids as of this writing, with the most recent bid currently sitting at $15,500. The listing also confirms that bids on the lot will be accepted until July 16 at 9:51 AM PT / 12:51 PM ET.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/gamestop-is-auctioning-off-the-stapler-and-the-staple-that-damaged-a-nintendo-switch-2-on-launch-day/1100-6533066/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
